resources.string: My Shadow Gallery - a hidden gallery for storing encrypted images with restricted access: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=%1$s
File encrypted in My Shadow Gallery. To view, request the key from the sender and use the decryptor: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=%1$s
Message to the Developer of this App
Media library will be available in this window
An app for those who have secrets...

The app captures and stores photos in encrypted form. Images are not accessible to the gallery and other apps. Access to the app is password-protected and disguised as a music app. Images saved using encryption cannot be read without the key, even if the file is extracted from the phone. Security concept: all data is stored only on the users device, no server-side storage of user images, previews, keys, passwords is applied. However, the user can share images in both encrypted and decrypted forms. Receive images from other users and decrypt them using a similar encryption key.

- Previews are stored in the internal app directory with the extension .p and are not encrypted. The preview scale in pixels can be selected in Settings from 1x1 px to 100x100 px. 

 - Original images are stored in the internal app directory. When encryption is used, the file is saved with the extension .kk. If the user chooses not to use encryption, the file is saved with the extension .o. When the user shares a decrypted image, a temporary file with the extension .peekaboo is created. In this form, the file can be sent by any means available to the device. Once the user closes the view window of this image, the decrypted copy is deleted from the device. That is, encrypted images are only stored in encrypted form. The user can change the encryption settings through the Settings menu. 

 - The encryption key and password are stored on the device in a secure form. For security reasons, there is no way to recover the key and password. If you forget the password to log into the app, the best solution is to uninstall and reinstall the app. In case of loss of the encryption key, you can create another key without reinstalling the app, however, images saved with the old key will not be accessible for viewing. Clear the image storage, change the key or password through the Settings menu.

The app has three encryption modes:

 1. NO ENCRYPTION. Saving files without entering an encryption key ‚Äì files are stored on the device in a format inaccessible to other apps and the gallery, but an attacker can extract and read them if they gain access to the device. When a file sent from the device is received, its contents can be read. 

 2. CONSTANT ENCRYPTION KEY (optimal option). The user comes up with or generates an encryption key. The key is used to encrypt the file according to the Advanced Encryption Standard. The file is stored on the device in an encrypted form, and even with access to the devices memory (or with a received encrypted file from the device), an attacker cannot read the contents without the encryption key. The key is stored in the app in a secure hashed form. The user can create and store up to three keys in the app. 

 3. VARIABLE ENCRYPTION KEY. If the user checks the "Do not save encryption key" option, the key will not be stored in the app and will be requested each time when entering. The key exists in the app only while it is open. The highest level of security; however, if you forget the old key, files previously saved with this key will not be accessible for viewing. In the Settings menu, you can always change security options.
Clear the key when closing the session \n(the key will be requested when entering)
Here will be an error message,\nicon will change depending\non the nature of the error
Clear All Data: Reset Settings, Key, Password, Clear Storage

Image Encryptionüîè\nAllow the app to generate a unique encryption key or create your own. The key is used for encryption with the Advanced Encryption Standard. Images and key are stored on the device in a secure encrypted form.
Previously saved encryption keys were found in the storage. Press the key name to select it as the default key. Press the "Trash" button to delete the key
To change the password, enter the old and new passwords
! After the last attempt, settings will be reset, and storage will be cleared !
"Sensitive information and personal data can be completely deleted by pressing the CLEAR ALL DATA button above"
File sent to the app. Enter the app for processing.

App Storage Image Log.
 The preview is saved with the extension .p.
Encrypted files are saved with the extension .kk
 Files saved without encryption have the extension .o
 The decrypted file, shared by the user, exists in the system for a short time with the extension .peekaboo
 A file passed to the app using the "share" function exists in the system with the extension .share

(Up to three encryption keys can be stored in the system)
Delete one of the old keys
(Existing encryption keys will be deleted from the app, and the user will have to enter the key each time they log in)
Use the key for the session
Enter the key manually (if decryption is successful, the file will be re-encoded with the default key)
Press the number eight to confirm
